DOC.brief_summary: This is an observational study looking at the characteristics of patients consulting for genital warts in the first semester 2010 at the public sexual health clinic of Valparaiso, Chile. The objectives are: to have an epidemiological profile, estimating cost of the disease for the health system and the patient and analyzing possible psychosocial consequences of the condition for the patients.
DOC.brief_title: Epidemiology, Costs and Psychosocial Consequences of Genital Warts in Valparaiso, Chile
DOC.criteria: Men and women 18 years of age or older Having being diagnosed with genital warts Consulting the sexual health clinic only for genital warts Patients accepting to be included in the study Immunodeficiency HIV positive Having being diagnosed with cancer or precancerous lesions Pregnancy Presenting a sexual transmissible infection other than genital warts.
